item.title: Report E-2024040294
item.description:
Report E-2024040294

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately two quarts of regulated UN1325 "Lap Sealant" was released from a case containing (25) eleven-ounce tubes due to being punctured by a forklift. The release impacted Trailer #317-1650. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. The damaged case of tubes, impacted "Oil Dri", and spent PPE were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum.

item.title: Report E-2024040256
item.description:
Report E-2024040256

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 3, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3098 was damaged prior to arrival and released approximately 55-gallons of product to the trailer interior and further migrated to the asphalt. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected the damaged 55-gallon drum and placed it in a 95-gallon over-pack drum for disposal. TLE deployed soda ash to the impacted asphalt and trailer floor to neutralize the release. Crews utilized hand tools to collect all impacted soda ash from the asphalt and the trailer floor. All hydrogen peroxide and peroxyacetic acid impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 95-gallon drum and thirteen (13) 35-gallon drums and added to RLC waste stream for disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2.5-gallons of Isopropyl Alcohol released from one 5-gallon metal pail after it was punctured by a forklift. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and the caller determined that terminal staff were capable of cleaning the release with PPE on-site. The waste was containerized into one (1) 8-gallon metal drum.

item.description:
Report X-2024040276

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: CAMBRIDGE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was discovered wet by a Packages Handler, and they immediately brought it to QA's Attention. I got a Damage HazMat tote and put the damaged hazmat in the tote and back to the Damage HazMat Cage. DescribePack: The seal to the Delimer was not completely sealed and the lid was not tightened appropriately, causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The lids were all checked and tightened appropriately to stop any leakage.

item.title: Report E-2024040206
item.description:
Report E-2024040206

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-11T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAY experienced a UN2922 Nalcon 7634 release from 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 100-gallons of product released to 60' x 20' area of the concrete dock and a 40' x 15' area of the asphalt parking lot due to a forklift puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted area to clean the release. All impacted absorbents were containerized into (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with impacted absorbents and PPE into a cubic yard box. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040208
item.description:
Report E-2024040208

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-11T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XTM contacted ERTS regarding a punctured leaking 5-gallon PAIL containing Endurastrip. The PAIL was punctured by a Forklift. The PAIL released all 5-gallons that impacted the wooden trailer floor and the concrete dock floor. The trailer floor had an impact area of 28’x5’. The dock floor had an impact area of 10’x1’. A Contractor cleaned up the release and repalletized the remaining, un-damaged product. Two drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024040218
item.description:
Report E-2024040218

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-11T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: STREETSBORO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a box that was slightly wet. Further investigation revealed that the enclosed plastic container had a loose lid which as a result consequently leaked some product out of and onto the box. The lid was tightened and the box put aside until it dried then it was placed into a recovery container and sent to the ultimate consignee without further incident.
